Release Clause
Acceptance of payment under section 1002(c) barred the person from coming back later to assert a claim for
either a larger payment under Section 1002(e) for a person who later becomes a U.S. citizen,
or
payment on some other basis not currently recognized by statute, such as
entitlement to additional damages for human suffering
the difference between the compensation actually received and compensation at the full-dollar rate
reparations
restitution, or
payment under some other equitable theory.
Important
: Â In light of Section 1002(h)(2), acceptance of a payment under Section 1002(c) does not prevent Filipinos from continuing to receive any benefits to which they may have been entitled under Title 38 as of the day before the date of enactment of
PL 111-5
.
